alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 7:28PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Calhoun County through 815 PM CDT... At 728 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alexandria, or 8 miles west of Jacksonville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Anniston, Oxford, Jacksonville, Fort McClellan, Saks, West End-Cobb Town, Glencoe, Weaver, Ohatchee, Hobson City, Oxford Lake, Blue Mountain, Alexandria, Jacksonville State University, Southside, Sulphur Springs and Wellington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
